strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
It's the weekend! Here are a few ideas to get the fun started.

  • 🎨 Artsy types: It's First Friday in Downtown Bentonville, and the theme is Art Fest — a celebration of creativity, engaging all five senses on Jun 2, with events happening on the Square from 11a-9p.
  • 🧵 It's called fashion: Interform's inaugural fashion and art biennial ASSEMBLY kicks off this weekend with a Gallery Crawl through Downtown Springdale on Friday, Jun 2, from 6-10p.
  • 📚 Let's book it: Fayetteville Public Library will host its Summer Reading Kickoff! including bounce houses, face painting, stilt walkers, bubbles, food, and more on Saturday, Jun 3, from 9:30a-12:30p. 
  • 🐷 Pigsty: Get down and dirty during the 9th Annual Pig Trail Mud Run, a 5K obstacle course in Springdale, on Saturday, Jun 3, at 7a.
  • 🚂 All aboard: The Rogers Historical Museum will host a day of food, crafts, games, model trains, and more during Family Day this Saturday, Jun 3, from 10a-2p.
  • 🏓 Dam slam: Grab your partner and head to Bentonville's Osage Park for the first-ever Dam Slam pickleball tournament this Saturday and Sunday, Jun 3-4.
  • 🛍️ That's rad: Check out Downtown Rogers' Art District's newest makers market — the RAD on 2nd will feature 40+ local artisans and vendors at 718 N. 2nd St. this Sunday, Jun 4, from 10a-4p.
  • 🎡 Gettin' muddy: Lowell continues its annual Mudtown Days this weekend at Ward Nail Park, including car shows, an ATV mud run, kids' pageants, carnival rides, and pore.
  • 🎸 Blues: Jump into the sound of blues, rock, and funk during The Eureka Springs Blues Party, lasting until Jun 4.
  • 🌸 Just tickled: Pink House Alchemy is celebrating 10 years with a Paint the Town Pink party, including a popup shop with Cheap Thrills, portraits from Happy Aura, and flash tattoos from Paper Doll Tattoo!
  • 🫐 Berry blast: Neal Family Farm in Rogers is open for the blueberry picking season, open Friday and Saturday from 8-11a and 5-8p and on Sunday from 5-8p.
  • 🏎️ Fast & Furious: Drift into the weekend with Reaction Motorsports during a family-friendly racing drifting & autocross event at Drake Field in Fayetteville this Saturday and Sunday, Jun 3-4.

Enjoy your weekend, NWA! We'll see you Monday.
